captions.text:
00:09
COMM: Shaun Ellis from Devon in england has

integrated himself into a pack of wild wolves.
The 47 year old lives like one of the predators.

Only eating meat and barely washing in order
to be accepted.

00:23
SHAUN: The actual integration of the pack

itself began when the wolves in particular
were only a few days of age. I still consider
myself to be part of that family.

00:33
COMM: Shaun who's become known as the Wolf

Man for his unusual research techniques, is
now passing on his skills to wife Isla.

00:45
COMM: The pair met through their shared love
of native american culture.

00:49
ISLA: Yeah it was actually love at first sight,

I always had this image in my head of my dream
man, my ideal man and obviously that's an

image, just a dream because you don't think
you'll ever meet that person but I guess I

was fortunate enough and lucky enough to meet
the man of my dreams.

01:05
COMM: Unlike your average household pet, these

wolves aren't on a diet of pedigree chum.
Instead devouring huge legs of horse meat
once a week.

01:13
SHAUN: All their social position, where they

are on the carcass would have all been established
long before we got here with the food.

01:21
SHAUN: So we've got our enforcer, our alpha

female, or decision making female and then
our dominant male heading off into the background
there.

01:34
SHAUN: I don't think there's anything special

about me but there's certainly something special
in the animals I work with, and they don't

deserve the maligning reputation that they've
got. They're not vicious creatures that would

attack us by the full moon. And it's ironic
that still to this day we have people that

call them savage ruthless killer, but I've
come to know and love them as family.
